description: Radiating heat is inefficent. Lets fix that.
Machines will /6/warn you if they are radiating/6/ lots of heat or cold. /b/Place blocks/b/ or /b/Thermal Lagging/b/ on /6/all faces of the block/6/ to prevent loss of tempature.
/b/Thermal Lagging/b/ insulates the same as any block, but still /6/allows interaction through it/6/. Use a /b/Pneumatic Wrench/b/ to remove.
/b/Compressed Alloy Blocks/b/ can /6/transport tempature/6/, but will /c/radiate a lot/c/ if not insulated. /b/Heat pipes/b/ /6/come with insulation/6/, and are much more compact.
/c/Some blocks will transform into another/c/ after transfering lots of heat. Lava solidifes, ice melts, etc. Watch out for those.
